<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is part of a workaround for a GCC 4.7 crash on lambdas.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BT&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/blockedgesadder">BlockEdgesAdder</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Mass of a block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class implements a sort of fixed-point fraction always between 0 and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1.0.  getMass() == std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;::max() indicates a value of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1.0.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Masses can be added and subtracted.  Simple saturation arithmetic is used,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// so arithmetic operations never overflow or underflow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Masses can be multiplied.  Multiplication treats full mass as 1 and uses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an inexpensive floating-point algorithm that&#39;s off-by-one (almost, but not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// quite, maximum precision).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Masses can be scaled by \\a BranchProbability at maximum precision.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t Mass = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a>() = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Add another mass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Adds another mass, saturating at \\a isFull() rather than overflowing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#ae147ad20e63a91b33aff8585bbe37a9f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#ae147ad20e63a91b33aff8585bbe37a9f">operator+=</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t Sum = Mass + <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>.Mass;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Mass = Sum &lt; Mass ? std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;::max() : Sum;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Subtract another mass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Subtracts another mass, saturating at \\a isEmpty() rather than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// undeflowing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#a625caa14bc11574f2ac44c67a9474cb6"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#a625caa14bc11574f2ac44c67a9474cb6">operator-=</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t Diff = Mass - <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>.Mass;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Mass = Diff &gt; Mass ? 0 : Diff;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#ab2afbd73bd9870df1aec09a821b80b8d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#ab2afbd73bd9870df1aec09a821b80b8d">operator&#42;=</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobability">BranchProbability</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Base class for BlockFrequencyInfoImpl</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Resolve a node to its representative.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// In general, the complexity is O(L), where L is the number of loop</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// an early exit edge jumps out of.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Unscaled probability weight.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Probability weight for an edge in the graph (including the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// successor/target node).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// All edges in the original function are 32-bit.  However, exit edges from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop packages are taken from 64-bit exit masses, so we need 64-bits of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// space in general.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// In addition to the raw weight amount, Weight stores the type of the edge</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in the current context (i.e., the context of the loop being processed).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Is this a local edge within the loop, an exit from the loop, or a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// backedge to the loop header?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/weight"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/weight/#af6d6f33b83e5ef8cd04b509149ad7b79">Weight</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute the loop scale for a loop.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Adjust the mass of all headers in an irreducible loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Initially, irreducible loops are assumed to distribute their mass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// equally among its headers. This can lead to wrong frequency estimates</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// since some headers may be executed more frequently than others.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This adjusts header mass distribution so it matches the weights of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the backedges going into each of the loop headers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/#af8aa6262fff3f09a8e2076d7a76e1628">adjustLoopHeaderMass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata">LoopData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Get the name of a MachineBasicBlock.  It&#39;s templated so that including from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CodeGen is unnecessary (that would be a layering issue).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MachineBasicBlock::getFullName(), but skips the name of the function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bfi-detail/#a01e9ac225b83bb4ded4adbba7d360cbe"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BlockT&gt; std::string <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bfi-detail/#a01e9ac225b83bb4ded4adbba7d360cbe">getBlockName</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BlockT &#42;BB) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(BB &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Unexpected nullptr&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BB-&gt;getBasicBlock())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MachineName + </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&#91;&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> + BB-&gt;getName() + </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&#93;&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">).str();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Graph of irreducible control flow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This graph is used for determining the SCCs in a loop (or top-level</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function) that has irreducible control flow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// During the block frequency algorithm, the local graphs are defined in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// light-weight way, deferring to the \\a BasicBlock or \\a MachineBasicBlock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// graphs for most edges, but getting others from \\a LoopData::ExitMap.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// latter only has successor information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\a IrreducibleGraph makes this graph explicit.  It&#39;s in a form that can use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\a GraphTraits (so that \\a analyzeIrreducible() can use \\a scc&#95;iterator),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and it explicitly lists predecessors and successors.  The initialization</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that relies on \\c MachineBasicBlock is defined in the header.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a1147f0ef1ac705077e24462022b4ae1e">IrreducibleGraph</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a2d4ad30cd1d596501e3d99462d1af74e"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a2d4ad30cd1d596501e3d99462d1af74e">IrreducibleGraph::addEdges</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a4f2854e822f1b323869fb6c7ae6fc0d0">BlockNode</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace bfi&#95;detail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Shared implementation for block frequency analysis.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a shared implementation of BlockFrequencyInfo and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MachineBlockFrequencyInfo, and calculates the relative frequencies of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// blocks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LoopInfo defines a loop as a &quot;non-trivial&quot; SCC dominated by a single block,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// which is called the header.  A given loop, L, can have sub-loops, which are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loops within the subgraph of L that exclude its header.  (A &quot;trivial&quot; SCC</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// consists of a single block that does not have a self-edge.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In addition to loops, this algorithm has limited support for irreducible</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SCCs, which are SCCs with multiple entry blocks.  Irreducible SCCs are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// discovered on the fly, and modelled as loops with multiple headers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The headers of irreducible sub-SCCs consist of its entry blocks and all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// nodes that are targets of a backedge within it (excluding backedges within</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// true sub-loops).  Block frequency calculations act as if a block is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inserted that intercepts all the edges to the headers.  All backedges and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// entries point to this block.  Its successors are the headers, which split</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the frequency evenly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This algorithm leverages BlockMass and ScaledNumber to maintain precision,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// separates mass distribution from loop scaling, and dithers to eliminate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// probability mass loss.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The implementation is split between BlockFrequencyInfoImpl, which knows the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// type of graph being modelled (BasicBlock vs. MachineBasicBlock), and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase, which doesn&#39;t.  The base class uses \\a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BlockNode, a wrapper around a uint32&#95;t.  BlockNode is numbered from 0 in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// reverse-post order.  This gives two advantages:  it&#39;s easy to compare the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// relative ordering of two nodes, and maps keyed on BlockT can be represented</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by vectors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This algorithm is O(V+E), unless there is irreducible control flow, in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// which case it&#39;s O(V&#42;E) in the worst case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// These are the main stages:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  0 Reverse post-order traversal (\\a initializeRPOT()).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Run a single post-order traversal and save it (in reverse) in RPOT.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     All other stages make use of this ordering.  Save a lookup from BlockT</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     to BlockNode (the index into RPOT) in Nodes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  1 Loop initialization (\\a initializeLoops()).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Translate LoopInfo/MachineLoopInfo into a form suitable for the rest of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     the algorithm.  In particular, store the immediate members of each loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     in reverse post-order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  2 Calculate mass and scale in loops (\\a computeMassInLoops()).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     For each loop (bottom-up), distribute mass through the DAG resulting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     from ignoring backedges and treating sub-loops as a single pseudo-node.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Track the backedge mass distributed to the loop header, and use it to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     calculate the loop scale (number of loop iterations).  Immediate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     members that represent sub-loops will already have been visited and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     packaged into a pseudo-node.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Distributing mass in a loop is a reverse-post-order traversal through</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     the loop.  Start by assigning full mass to the Loop header.  For each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     node in the loop:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         - Fetch and categorize the weight distribution for its successors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           If this is a packaged-subloop, the weight distribution is stored</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           in \\a LoopData::Exits.  Otherwise, fetch it from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           BranchProbabilityInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         - Each successor is categorized as \\a Weight::Local, a local edge</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           within the current loop, \\a Weight::Backedge, a backedge to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           loop header, or \\a Weight::Exit, any successor outside the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           The weight, the successor, and its category are stored in \\a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           Distribution.  There can be multiple edges to each successor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         - If there&#39;s a backedge to a non-header, there&#39;s an irreducible SCC.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           The usual flow is temporarily aborted.  \\a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           computeIrreducibleMass() finds the irreducible SCCs within the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           loop, packages them up, and restarts the flow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         - Normalize the distribution:  scale weights down so that their sum</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           is 32-bits, and coalesce multiple edges to the same node.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         - Distribute the mass accordingly, dithering to minimize mass loss,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///           as described in \\a distributeMass().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     In the case of irreducible loops, instead of a single loop header,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     there will be several. The computation of backedge masses is similar</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     but instead of having a single backedge mass, there will be one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     backedge per loop header. In these cases, each backedge will carry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     a mass proportional to the edge weights along the corresponding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     At the end of propagation, the full mass assigned to the loop will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     distributed among the loop headers proportionally according to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     mass flowing through their backedges.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Finally, calculate the loop scale from the accumulated backedge mass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  3 Distribute mass in the function (\\a computeMassInFunction()).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Finally, distribute mass through the DAG resulting from packaging all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     loops in the function.  This uses the same algorithm as distributing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     mass in a loop, except that there are no exit or backedge edges.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  4 Unpackage loops (\\a unwrapLoops()).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Initialize each block&#39;s frequency to a floating point representation of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     its mass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Visit loops top-down, scaling the frequencies of its immediate members</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     by the loop&#39;s pseudo-node&#39;s frequency.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  5 Convert frequencies to a 64-bit range (\\a finalizeMetrics()).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Using the min and max frequencies as a guide, translate floating point</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     frequencies to an appropriate range in uint64&#95;t.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It has some known flaws.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - The model of irreducible control flow is a rough approximation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Modelling irreducible control flow exactly involves setting up and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     solving a group of infinite geometric series.  Such precision is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     unlikely to be worthwhile, since most of our algorithms give up on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     irreducible control flow anyway.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Nevertheless, we might find that we need to get closer.  Here&#39;s a sort</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     of TODO list for the model with diminishing returns, to be completed as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     necessary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       - The headers for the \\a LoopData representing an irreducible SCC</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         include non-entry blocks.  When these extra blocks exist, they</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         indicate a self-contained irreducible sub-SCC.  We could treat them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         as sub-loops, rather than arbitrarily shoving the problematic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         blocks into the headers of the main irreducible SCC.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       - Entry frequencies are assumed to be evenly split between the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         headers of a given irreducible SCC, which is the only option if we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         need to compute mass in the SCC before its parent loop.  Instead,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         we could partially compute mass in the parent loop, and stop when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         we get to the SCC.  Here, we have the correct ratio of entry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         masses, which we can use to adjust their relative frequencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         Compute mass in the SCC, and then continue propagation in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         parent.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       - We can propagate mass iteratively through the SCC, for some fixed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         number of iterations.  Each iteration starts by assigning the entry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         blocks their backedge mass from the prior iteration.  The final</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         mass for each block (and each exit, and the total backedge mass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         used for computing loop scale) is the sum of all iterations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         (Running this until fixed point would &quot;solve&quot; the geometric</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         series by simulation.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BT&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ac61cd6020768ae1e60dc3040ce5fbd8d">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl</a> : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase">BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is part of a workaround for a GCC 4.7 crash on lambdas.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/blockedgesadder">bfi&#95;detail::BlockEdgesAdder</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/bittracker-cpp/#ae3e523a6a11b1e24604b40363978a62a">BT</a>&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">FunctionT = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/typemap">bfi&#95;detail::TypeMap&lt;BT&gt;::FunctionT</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">BranchProbabilityInfoT =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/typemap">bfi&#95;detail::TypeMap&lt;BT&gt;::BranchProbabilityInfoT</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">LoopT = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/typemap">bfi&#95;detail::TypeMap&lt;BT&gt;::LoopT</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">LoopInfoT = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/typemap">bfi&#95;detail::TypeMap&lt;BT&gt;::LoopInfoT</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">Successor = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/graphtraits">GraphTraits&lt;const BlockT &#42;&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">Predecessor = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/graphtraits">GraphTraits&lt;Inverse&lt;const BlockT &#42;&gt;</a>&gt;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Run (and save) a post-order traversal.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Saves a reverse post-order traversal of all the nodes in \\a F.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> initializeRPOT();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Initialize loop data.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Build up \\a Loops using \\a LoopInfo.  \\a LoopInfo gives us a mapping from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each block to the deepest loop it&#39;s in, but we need the inverse.  For each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop, we store in reverse post-order its &quot;immediate&quot; members, defined as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the header, the headers of immediate sub-loops, and all other blocks in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the loop that are not in sub-loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="899"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> initializeLoops();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="900"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Propagate to a block&#39;s successors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// In the context of distributing mass through \\c OuterLoop, divide the mass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="904"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// currently assigned to \\c Node between its successors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="905"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="906"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\return \\c true unless there&#39;s an irreducible backedge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00907" /><CodeLine lineNumber="907"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> propagateMassToSuccessors(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata">LoopData</a> &#42;OuterLoop, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/blocknode">BlockNode</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00909" /><CodeLine lineNumber="909"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute mass in a particular loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00910" /><CodeLine lineNumber="910"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="911"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Assign mass to \\c Loop&#39;s header, and then for each block in \\c Loop in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// reverse post-order, distribute mass to its successors.  Only visits nodes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that have not been packaged into sub-loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\pre \\a computeMassInLoop() has been called for each subloop of \\c Loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\return \\c true unless there&#39;s an irreducible backedge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> computeMassInLoop(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata">LoopData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Try to compute mass in the top-level function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Assign mass to the entry block, and then for each block in reverse</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// post-order, distribute mass to its successors.  Skips nodes that have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// been packaged into loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\pre \\a computeMassInLoops() has been called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\return \\c true unless there&#39;s an irreducible backedge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> tryToComputeMassInFunction();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute mass in (and package up) irreducible SCCs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Find the irreducible SCCs in \\c OuterLoop, add them to \\a Loops (in front</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of \\c Insert), and call \\a computeMassInLoop() on each of them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If \\c OuterLoop is \\c nullptr, it refers to the top-level function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\pre \\a computeMassInLoop() has been called for each subloop of \\c</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// OuterLoop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\pre \\c Insert points at the last loop successfully processed by \\a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// computeMassInLoop().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\pre \\c OuterLoop has irreducible SCCs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> computeIrreducibleMass(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata">LoopData</a> &#42;OuterLoop,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              std::list&lt;LoopData&gt;::iterator Insert);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute mass in all loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For each loop bottom-up, call \\a computeMassInLoop().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\a computeMassInLoop() aborts (and returns \\c false) on loops that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// contain a irreducible sub-SCCs.  Use \\a computeIrreducibleMass() and then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// re-enter \\a computeMassInLoop().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\post \\a computeMassInLoop() has returned \\c true for every loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> computeMassInLoops();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute mass in the top-level function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Uses \\a tryToComputeMassInFunction() and \\a computeIrreducibleMass() to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// compute mass in the top-level function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\post \\a tryToComputeMassInFunction() has returned \\c true.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> computeMassInFunction();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::string <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineblockplacement-cpp/#a8f9ee7f9ffc036496a8663335da175fa">getBlockName</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/blocknode">BlockNode</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const override </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bfi-detail/#a01e9ac225b83bb4ded4adbba7d360cbe">bfi&#95;detail::getBlockName</a>(getBlock(<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The current implementation for computing relative block frequencies does</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// not handle correctly control-flow graphs containing irreducible loops. To</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// resolve the problem, we apply a post-processing step, which iteratively</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// updates block frequencies based on the frequencies of their predesessors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This corresponds to finding the stationary point of the Markov chain by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="972"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// an iterative method aka &quot;PageRank computation&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The algorithm takes at most O(|E| &#42; IterativeBFIMaxIterations) steps but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="974"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// typically converges faster.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Decide whether we want to apply iterative inference for a given function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="977"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> needIterativeInference() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="978"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="979"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Apply an iterative post-processing to infer correct counts for irr loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="980"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> applyIterativeInference();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">ProbMatrixType = std::vector&lt;std::vector&lt;std::pair&lt;size&#95;t, Scaled64&gt;&gt;&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Run iterative inference for a probability matrix and initial frequencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="985"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> iterativeInference(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ProbMatrixType &amp;ProbMatrix,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          std::vector&lt;Scaled64&gt; &amp;Freq) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="987"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="988"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Find all blocks to apply inference on, that is, reachable from the entry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and backward reachable from exists along edges with positive probability.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="990"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> findReachableBlocks(std::vector&lt;const BlockT &#42;&gt; &amp;Blocks) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="991"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="992"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Build a matrix of probabilities with transitions (edges) between the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="993"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// blocks: ProbMatrix&#91;I&#93; holds pairs (J, P), where Pr&#91;J -&gt; I | J&#93; = P</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> initTransitionProbabilities(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="996"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;const BlockT &#42;, size&#95;t&gt;</a> &amp;BlockIndex,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="997"><span class="doxyHighlight">      ProbMatrixType &amp;ProbMatrix) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="999"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ad41feeb3401a872b89169602cbb541a7"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ad41feeb3401a872b89169602cbb541a7">forgetBlock</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BlockT &#42;BB) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We don&#39;t erase corresponding items from &#96;Freqs&#96;, &#96;RPOT&#96; and other to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// avoid invalidating indices. Doing so would have saved some memory, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it&#39;s not worth it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Nodes.erase(BB);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Print the frequencies for the current function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Prints the frequencies for the blocks in the current function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Blocks are printed in the natural iteration order of the function, rather</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// than reverse post-order.  This provides two advantages:  writing -analyze</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// tests is easier (since blocks come out in source order), and even</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// unreachable blocks are printed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\a BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase::print() only knows reverse post-order, so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// we need to override it here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ad05ed8871c23e9c87114b754bc6098ab"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ad05ed8871c23e9c87114b754bc6098ab">print</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1369"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can be reached from the entry by edges with a positive probability.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1370"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Non-processed blocks are assigned with the zero frequency and are ignored</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1371"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the computation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1372"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;const BlockT &#42;&gt; ReachableBlocks;</span></CodeLine>
